headline: Chef John's Salmon Cakes
description: Use canned wild red salmon to make Chef John's salmon cakes — a budget-friendly recipe for homemade fish cakes.

video.description: Canned wild salmon is the key to these simple and amazing cakes.
video.name: Chef John's Salmon Cakes

name: Chef John's Salmon Cakes
recipeIngredient: 1 (14.75 ounce) can red salmon, skin and bone removed, drained and flaked
1 tablespoon bread crumbs, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Stir salmon, eggs, lemon juice, capers, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper together in a bowl until well-combined.
Crush saltine crackers with your hands into the salmon mixture and mix well. Wrap the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate, 30 minutes to overnight.
Dust a plate with half the bread crumbs. Divide salmon mixture into 4 portions and shape into patties; place onto prepared plate and sprinkle remaining bread crumbs atop the salmon patties.
Melt butter and oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook patties in hot oil until cooked and heated through, about 5 minutes per side.

review.reviewBody: No recipe changes and we loved it. Served with a heaping bunch of coleslaw.

Just what I was looking for to use up fresh cooked salmon. Husband and I used to buy 2 orders of fish and chips take out at a great place with the total being almost $40. I now buy a slab of fresh salmon for $20-$24 dollars and cut into 6 or eight generous pieces and do baked potatoes or fries in the air fryer. I cook all the salmon pieces at once and the leftovers are great cold but by the third leftovers dinner we want something different and these salmon cakes are great!!
good taste but sometime salmon has a sharp taste so I add dillweed to help add another favor and the lemon is to much, so I cut that out.
I've made this many times. Quite often there is markdown salmon in the store. I make these up and have some for dinner and some for the freezer. Good with chipotle mayo.

Not bad, but a little disappointing. As with lots of recipes here, it could use a bit more spice. The patties didn't hold together very well and were a bit messy. I will probably make this again, but with some tweaks. It's a good basic recipe for canned fish, just needs a little adjustment.
Fabulous! The aioli sauce really moves the recipe up another peg! I omitted capers because I didn’t have any. My husband said “you can make this again!”

Sorry but too bitter/sour. Made exact recipe. I know you like capers Chef John and as do I, but I will have to remove or adjust amount of lemon or capers. 
Also I don't get rid of bones and all. They just fall apart and contain a lot of nutrients. I know they seem gross in can but just mush with a fork if u need to.
Pretty good especially as it's easy to keep canned salmon on hand. I will, however, try to always make Chef John's salmon cakes made with fresh salmon. Quite a bit better.

This was just amazing! Chef John never disappoints! Watched video and got all the good tips. Only things I did slightly different was to eliminate the salt and add some old bay! I served as suggested with the tarragon Aioli (another link) and it was the BOMB!

I omitted the cayenne & black pepper because I'm a wimp about spicy things. I also omitted the added salt because saltines are pretty salty on their own. Hubby & I both enjoyed the very flavorful result. It didn't even need tartar sauce. My only complaint is that despite refrigerating several hours, I found the mixture rather juicy when trying to make the patties, however I may not have squeezed enough juice out of the salmon before making the mixture.

Yep, it's a pain in the backside to hand-pick through all that canned salmon...but the result is worth it. I added a little Old Bay seasoning but otherwise stayed true to the recipee. Will have this one agian.
It was OK but prefer my own receipe
Excellent!!! Could not believe how delicious this dish was!!! I did not have Saltines so I used Panko instead. This recipe is a keeper!!!
I have made these dozens of times. Best recipe ever for Salmon Cakes. I don't do capers but everything else. Love the spice of red peppers to give it some zing.
Followed the recipe but my patties fell apart when pressing the bread crumbs in and while in the pan. Didn't care for the sourness from the capers and lemon juice. Always happy to try a new recipe.

I hated salmon patties when I was a kid, so trying these was more than a bit of a gamble. But they were delicious. Watched the video and followed as written--no changes. Thanks, Chef John, for helping me get over my phobia!
Worked out perfectly and very tasty. Served them with a nice salad and had a nice light dinner.
These were very good! Even my husband commented on how good they were. He usually will add tarter sauce on any fish but didn’t need to on this dish.

I absolutely love this recipe I did Donny own thing a little and baked salmon early in the day and used fresh instead of canned . Everything els I did exactly. I also made his Aioli sauce ! It took an hour lol since I never made it , my mom and fiancé devoured it . My mom said it was wonderful and would easily pay 25$ for the dinner in a restaurant . She's very proud of me :) and I'm proud of myself as well! Thank you chef John ! Another dinner accomplished ! He makes everything so easy to do and if there's a video to watch it makes it even easier !

Excellent, turned out perfectly even without refrigeration and frying it immediately. I did mix fresh salmon and canned tuna. I didn't have capers and subbed extra lemon juice, thyme and few bits of black olives. Delicious!

I always make this recipe as is. It's a great recipe as is. I also make the tarragon aioli with a mortar and pestle. I've said I'd never try to improve on it. Though like a delicious crab cake, I don't use bread crumbs for pan frying. Just butter.
THANK YOU CHEF JOHN!!!
Tim

very simple. I will add more things next time as he suggested in his video. I did choose to fry in 1 t.oil/1 t. butter. then a second of each for the other side to decrease the fat. I would add garlic powder, onion powder,. Not sure yet what else. Very quick meal, bur pick out all the bones as Chef John discussed.

Good. Wasn’t difficult. (I’m a guy) Would have really liked some side dish suggestions. I sautéed onions. 

But a good dish, overall. Wife came in (she likes to eat in front of the outdoor TV) complaining a little bit about the spiciness of the salmon. It kinda was. Maybe too many capers added. Plan to try again sometime, tho.

I only had one can of salmon so halved the recipe. Cooking for 5 min was too long or maybe I could have used lower flame. But like the crispy top. Also, could a sauce be included in the recipe? I wasn't sure what one to use and the orangish one looked the best but couldn't find it easily. Is this a romaleid-type sauce.
Its perfect. I added a little onion flakes, a little worcestershire sauce. But I didn't drain enough of the liquid out of the salmon, that's important. Loved this!
It tasted delicious but they break up while I was sauteeing them. I made it exactly as the recipe suggested.
Honestly nothing wrong with this recipe - just wasn't anything extraordinary. For a simple solid meal, a good option!
Perfection

Great recipe that lets you make it your own. I left the skin, bones and liquid in the salmon, added garlic, onion powder, dried dill, fresh parsley, and a few extra saltine crackers. The salmon cakes came out wonderfully and were a big hit.

I use the entire can, including liquid, bones and skin (minus a bit to the cats - they insist !) It adds waaaay more salmony flavor. Simply crush the bones with a fork or fingers. Then add more crackers (or dry oatmeal - my fav) to compensate.

This is a super easy recipe and a great way to use canned salmon. The cakes are flavorful, keep well for leftovers and have a great salmon taste. I added just a few anchovies to the mix just to see what would happen and I have to say that it heightened the taste but did not overwhelm it by any means. My wife could not identify this secret ingredient. I used unsalted crackers to limit the sodium a bit.
These cakes were awesome, spicy and flavorful. I didn’t realize I was out of capers when I started the prep, but used diced kalamata olives and they worked well.
I skipped the capers, but they were very good and I'll make them again.

This the best salmon patty recipe I have ever had. I have been sharing it with others. They were delicious and very moist. I love how he has videos for his recipes, I am very visual. Keep up the good work Chef John!!!!

I now use this recipe, I add zest of one lemon, then follow the ingredient list....mix everything and let it sit for 12-24 hours....these are the best salmon cakes I have made and the only recipe I use
I’ve been making and loving salmon patties for as long as I can remember. How is it that this recipe turns the cot

I'm going to "be that guy" and rate the recipe, then talk about my changes. Sorry! I didn't want to wait until I went to the grocery store to make the recipe. I didn't have saltines (don't like them) so I substituted panko bread crumbs. I also didn't have any capers on hand; I didn't have anything to substitute for the capers, but I threw in a dash of onion powder to add a little more flavor. Nevertheless, they were very simple to make and tasted great! Moist and full of flavor! I plan to make them again when I have the right ingredients; I'm sure they will be even better!

I have been making salmon patties for years. My mom made them for us when we were kids. I only use can salmon and a row of Ritz crackers crumbled up and one or two eggs depending on how many cans you use. No other seasonings. I'll have to try these

This recipe is delicious! 
I will be cooking this again!

This turned out better than I thought. I used leftover grilled salmon and only had whole wheat buttery round crackers. I used only one egg, and used a liquid garlic Cajun sauce to sub for the other egg. (added extra crumbs to bind) I also added Old Bay for extra seasoning before letting it sit overnight before frying. Great use for extra salmon!

My wife and I love salmon fishing and finding recipes for them. This is one of our favorites. We make enough to eat for two days and freeze the remaining cakes.
Best salmon cakes ever!
Seriously, you need to try this recipe without a single alteration.

My wife and I love salmon fishing and finding recipes for them. This is one of our favorites. We make enough to eat for two days and freeze the remaining cakes.
Best salmon cakes ever!
Seriously, you need to try this recipe without a single alteration.
It was excellent! Capers make all the difference. I’ll defiantly make these again!
Yum. This recipe is a keeper. Easy to make and very tasty.

These are easy to make and tasty. I used half of the black and cayenne pepper and it was good, not too spicy. I served with homemade tartar sauce. Next time I'm planning to add a little minced onion and some dill to the salmon mixture plus some salt and pepper to the bread crumbs before frying to add just a little more complexity.

I was the recipient of several cans of salmon. Chose this recipe because I have had such good results with Chef John’s video instructions. Didn’t have bread crumbs so whizzed a couple more crackers in the blender. Otherwise good texture and flavor. Will make again.
Oh, these are just like my Mom made 65 years ago when I was a child. She served with mashed potatoes and peas. Actually, she always made whipped potatoes.
Best salmon cakes I’ve ever made! So delicious! I added minced garlic and onions
Yum, Yum, Yum. My husband and I both loved it. Thanks again, Chef John!
I added onion and jalapeño which I cooked before hand. I grilled these and they are very delicate so I grilled on low heat. I’ll make again!
no changes. It was the best. Will never use canned salmo again.

I made as directed with one addition, i stalk of green onion, chopped. I let sit for two hours in the refrigerator, and fried them up I made 8 small ones instead of 4 large. 
So so good. I will make them again tonight.
My family loved this recipe. I had never used capers ever. Nor had I used lemon juice or Cayenne in my salmon cakes before. Big improvement .
My first salmon cakes. I added chopped onion and wasabi, and breaded the patties much more thoroughly. I ate two, immediately.
This is now my go to Salmon patty recipe. It comes out great every time! Chef John has great recipes and his videos are are so helpful.
My brother lives and fishes in Kenai, AK. He cans and ships salmon to me. This is my go-to recipe. Great as is, but sometimes I add 1 Tblsp of mayo...never dry.

These turned out as they should, but they were deinitely not a hit with the kids. I thought they were okay, but probably would have been better served on a bun with some cheese and mayo or tartar sauce and a bit of lettuce. Won't make them again.
Love, love, loved it! I was getting tired of my old salmon patty recipe and thought I would give this one a try. This one is a keeper for sure! I didn't change a thing, it's perfect the way it is.
It really doesn't taste like the bulk of this came out of a can! It also came together really well and was easy to make. Had it with some tartar sauce and it was pretty good.
Delicious! Left out the cayenne pepper, but it was still all good!
Just the way it is is fine. We like it a little more spicy so I would add in the future but perfect salmon patties as it is written.
Better the next day

Really like them as they are a looser than using bread crumbs as binder, kind of like a good crab cake. Kelchner cocktail sauce, broccoli/cauliflower/red pepper mix and glasses of KJ sauvignon blanc made for a great dinner!
The recipe was the best one I've ever tried. I only added some dried dill, garlic granules and onion granules to the seasonings. Otherwise, they cooked up superbly and very, very tasty.

I love salmon cakes....as long as someone else makes them! Well, until now. I will always hate picking out the skin & bones but these will always we be a big comfort food. Chef John can sound a little full of himself at times & with every recipe of his I follow he has a reason to be. Keep making those amazing videos!
No changes and I have made it twice and we love it! The 2nd time I added scallions because both our Moms' added onion and we like the extra flavor.

This was delicious! I will probably use fresh salmon next time, more for simplicity than anything else. Like other reviewers, I added some chopped onion (about 1/4-1/2 cup) and a sprinkle of old bay; I also added a touch of dried dill, dried parsley, and garlic powder. Used a breadcrumb/panko blend, and served the cakes with Home-made tartar sauce. Will definitely repeat - might make smaller parties, too.

Omitted the salt .Added 1/4 tsp fish sauce and fresh herbs 
basil, chives, tyme,garlic
Used Ritz veggie crackers because we didn't have regular saltines and leftover salmon. Delicious! Definitely going to repeat. Thanks for the recipe!
Excellent, best ever and followed the recipe. Served with Chef John's Remoulade Sauce. Will make again but will try Chef John's other Remoulade Sause 2.0
it was ok, nothing out of the ordinary this time
Easy to make. Delicious.
Very simple recipe, added diced green onion, minced fresh ginger and garlic. Made a burger and used AR's tartar sauce.
I have made this several times and changed nothing - Super easy and good
Love Chef John but not a fan of this one.

These were really good. I followed the directions and the capers really added great flavor. I had Club crackers instead of saltines. I only had 30 minutes to let them sit in the fridge and thought they certainly would be too wet and would fall apart. But they cooked up great in some butter and avocado oil. Ended up staying together and tasted great. Next time I’ll substitute Old Bay for some of the cayenne and salt. We sprinkled some on top this time. Next time I will find a recipe for a sauce.

This turned out great. I made a 1/2 portion with a 6 Oz. can of skinless boneless wild salmon which made preparation even easier. The added ingredients were perfect for making generous portions that were nicely crisp and really highlighted the Salmon flavor, which I love. I’ll be adding this to my favorites and look forward to making again. Thanks for Recipe!
I made ours with fresh Alaskan King Salmon and substituted PANKO bread crumbs rather than use saltines. Everyone enjoyed this recipe!
Way too spicy for my family. Needed way more bread crumbs than called for. Good flavor though.
This recipe turns out great. I use an egg with the mayonnaise and add panko until patties hold together. Also used salmon fillets that had been previously poached. Pretty and substantial meal.
Loved these, left-overs warmed well in microwave, served topped with sour cream and dill weed
Best canned salmon recipe I've tried.

These were great....I did not have capers and I did add finely diced green onion and celery, omitted salt that I can not have. Used Panko instead of crackers and lightly coated with masa before frying in a bit of canola oil.

I would add eggs so it would hold together.
The flavor was great and I’ll make it again.
I used fresh salmon that had been grilled
And was leftover.

I did not see Chef John's other salmon cakes recipe with fresh salmon or I would have tried it. I wanted a loaf so once I put this together I put it in a loaf pan and covered it with foil so it wouldn't dry out, then browned the top. I used left over baked salmon. I added a cup of minced onion, a cup of finely chopped celery, a tablespoon of dill weed. I only put in 1/4 tea of cayenne and did not use capers. I served it with a white sauce with lemon juice and dill weed in it. Absolutely perfect!

Made it exact to the recipe. It was OK, but VERY salty. I'm not someone who uses a whole lot of salt while cooking, so the combination of the salt in the recipe, the capers, and the salmon itself made the dish incredibly salty.
If I did it again - which I might - I'd cut all of the salty ingredients in half.
That said, the patties held together very well, and the texture was great! Crispy outside, tender inside, like seafood cakes should be.

I would've given this one more star except for a problem: the patties fell apart easily when I flipped them. I've been making salmon patties for years and never have them fall part like that. I think it may be because of the lime juice. The patties were a little wetter than the other recipes, but as typical of a CJ recipe, they tasted great. Next time I'll try without the lime juice and just add it on after cooking. Thanks for posting.

Hi Chef John,
Strongly doubt you'll see this, but you have two recipes of the same "salmon cakes," only difference is that one has eggs and lemon included and the other doesn't. I made the one without the eggs and they broke apart on me, then I saw this other copy of the recipe and noticed it was added. You might want to erase the other as they don't quite turn out as good. Other than that, my husband and I are big fans. Thanks
Great recipe. I added 1 tablespoon of mayonnaise and half chopped small onion. Delicious!!! My husband loved it. I will definitely make this over and over again.
My husband and I did not like these crab cakes at all. I gave the leftovers to the cats. I followed the recipe exactly as written.

I had salmon and really didn't know how to cook it. I found this recipe and was so pleased! This will be the only way I will cook salmon from now on. Thanks for such an easy to follow and great recipe
Not bad.....I didn't have capers but everything else was pretty much the same. I think this is one of those great basics that you can easily tweak to your own preference.

I make this regularly, and change up the flavoring a little bit each time. It's an easy tasty recipe that my husband will eat on a hamburger bun and I will eat with greens. I like using a salt free spice blend instead of the salt/pepper/cayenne mix and they come out great every time.

Loved this recipe. Served with creamy garlic sauce and it was fantastic.1/4 cup mayonnaise. 1 to 2 garlic cloves, shaved on a microplane, pressed through a garlic press, or very finely minced.1 tablespoon lemon juice. Heavy cream, to thin, if needed. Salt to taste.

Wonderful flavor, moist inside, yet a bit of crunch on the outside. I added a tsp. of mayo, substituted panko breadcrumbs for the saltines and used Old Bay instead of cayenne. Served with fresh steamed asparagus with Hollandaise Sauce (Chef John's recipe).
This is the best salmon patty recipe that I have ever made. Highly recommend that you try it. Very easy and quick.
Finally a salmon patty that isn't crumbling into pieces or just mush. The canned salmon and saltines made it work and that is all that matters to me. Thanks again chef.
I put fresh salmon with the tin salmon, very nice and tasty.

Doubled the recipe so we could take them for lunch the next day. These are so delicious! I left off the cayenne and used a little dill pickle instead of capers. Made a sour cream, cucumber, cilantro, lemon and garlic creamy dip to go with it and everyone loved it!
